user_error_text: Device Manager yellow warning appeared after driver update/install
symptoms: Yellow exclamation in Device Manager; device not working or limited
cause: Driver missing, corrupt, or incompatible after update
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the device and choose 'Properties' to view the error code.
step_2: Try 'Update driver' → Search automatically for drivers.
step_3: If that fails, 'Uninstall device' then 'Scan for hardware changes' to reinstall.
step_4: Download the official driver from OEM/motherboard website and install manually.
step_5: As a last resort, roll back the driver in Device Manager to a previous version.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: PnP: Device Manager yellow warning - driver package install failed

user_error_text: GPU driver crash — recent update shows device with yellow triangle in Device Manager
symptoms: Display driver stopped responding, screen flicker, crashes during graphics tasks
cause: Driver corruption, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware issues
step_1: Update GPU driver from official vendor site (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) in Safe Mode to remove old drivers, then reinstall.
step_3: Check GPU temps and power connections; ensure PSU provides enough power.
step_4: Test GPU in another system if possible to rule out hardware fault.
step_5: If crashes continue, revert to a stable older driver or contact vendor support.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: PnP: GPU driver crash - driver package install failed

user_error_text: Audio device not detected and system logs show driver initialization failure
symptoms: No audio device found, red X on speaker icon, no playback devices
cause: Driver missing, audio services stopped, or hardware disabled
step_1: Run Windows Audio Troubleshooter and follow suggested fixes.
step_2: In Device Manager, uninstall the audio device and restart to trigger reinstall.
step_3: Install official audio drivers from laptop/motherboard vendor site.
step_4: Check BIOS/UEFI to ensure onboard audio is enabled.
step_5: Restart Windows Audio services: net stop audiosrv && net start audiosrv.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: PnP: Audio device not detected - driver package install failed

user_error_text: I get USB device not recognized and the device isn't working after reboot
symptoms: USB device shows 'Unknown device' or not listed in Explorer
cause: Driver issue, power limitation, or faulty USB controller
step_1: Try different USB port and cable; test device on another PC.
step_2: In Device Manager, uninstall unknown device and scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Disable USB selective suspend in Power Options and restart.
step_4: Install chipset and USB controller drivers from OEM website.
step_5: If persistent, use a powered USB hub or replace the USB device.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: DriverFrameworks: USB device not recognized - driver failed to initialize

user_error_text: Printer driver failure and system logs show driver initialization failure
symptoms: Printer shows errors, cannot print, or documents stuck in queue
cause: Corrupt printer driver or incompatible driver after OS update
step_1: Clear print queue and restart Print Spooler service: net stop spooler && net start spooler.
step_2: Remove and reinstall the printer using the latest driver from the manufacturer's site.
step_3: Use 'Add a printer' wizard and select the correct driver manually if needed.
step_4: Try printing from another app or device to isolate the issue.
step_5: If network printer, ensure correct IP and that printer firmware is updated.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: DriverFrameworks: Printer driver failure - driver failed to initialize

user_error_text: Bluetooth driver not working and the device shows code 43
symptoms: Bluetooth devices not connecting or pairing fails
cause: Driver missing or Bluetooth service disabled
step_1: Toggle Bluetooth off/on and try pairing again.
step_2: In Device Manager, uninstall Bluetooth adapter then scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Install latest Bluetooth drivers from OEM website.
step_4: Ensure Bluetooth Support Service is running in Services.msc.
step_5: Check for physical switch on laptops that may disable Bluetooth.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: DeviceManager: Bluetooth driver not working shows yellow exclamation mark

user_error_text: Touchpad not working after update appeared after driver update/install
symptoms: Touchpad unresponsive after system or driver update
cause: Driver incompatibility or settings changed
step_1: Plug in an external mouse and go to Device Manager → Mice and other pointing devices.
step_2: Roll back touchpad driver or uninstall and reinstall the latest driver.
step_3: Check touchpad settings under Settings → Devices → Touchpad to ensure enabled.
step_4: Update chipset drivers which may affect input devices.
step_5: If using Synaptics/ELAN, install the OEM driver package rather than generic driver.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: DeviceManager: Touchpad not working after update shows yellow exclamation mark

user_error_text: Touchpad not working after update causes device malfunction and errors in Event Viewer
symptoms: Touchpad unresponsive after system or driver update
cause: Driver incompatibility or settings changed
step_1: Plug in an external mouse and go to Device Manager → Mice and other pointing devices.
step_2: Roll back touchpad driver or uninstall and reinstall the latest driver.
step_3: Check touchpad settings under Settings → Devices → Touchpad to ensure enabled.
step_4: Update chipset drivers which may affect input devices.
step_5: If using Synaptics/ELAN, install the OEM driver package rather than generic driver.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.

user_error_text: Network adapter driver missing and the device shows code 43
symptoms: No wired/wireless adapter in Device Manager; no network interfaces
cause: Driver removal, hardware disabled, or BIOS setting changed
step_1: Show hidden devices in Device Manager and 'Scan for hardware changes'.
step_2: Install network drivers from vendor site (chipset/ethernet/wifi drivers).
step_3: Check BIOS to ensure onboard NIC/Wi-Fi is enabled.
step_4: Use a USB-to-Ethernet adapter as a temporary workaround.
step_5: If hardware failed, replace NIC or consult technician.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: DeviceManager: Network adapter driver missing shows yellow exclamation mark

user_error_text: Driver signature enforcement blocking install — recent update shows device with yellow triangle in Device Manager
symptoms: Cannot install unsigned driver; installer fails with signature error
cause: Windows enforces driver signature verification; driver lacks valid signature
step_1: Download signed drivers from the official vendor site whenever possible.
step_2: Temporarily disable driver signature enforcement from Advanced Boot Options to install unsigned driver (not recommended long-term).
step_3: Use Test Mode only if trusted internal drivers are required; avoid third-party unsigned drivers.
step_4: Consider getting updated signed driver from vendor or contact vendor support.
step_5: Re-enable signature enforcement after installation for system security.
verification: Device functions correctly and Device Manager shows no errors after drivers updated/installed.
log_snippet: PnP: Driver signature enforcement blocking install - driver package install failed
